typedef std::vector<Approximator*> libpg::FactoredApproximator::Approximators

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

libpg::FactoredApproximator::FactoredApproximator ( Approximators  approximators,
bool  splitObs 
)

Construct a collection of approximators. Implements the many to one controller concept.

Parameters:
approximators vector of Approximator*
if true, expect as many colums in the observations as there are approximators and each controller only gets its col as an observation. If false, all approximators get the same observation.

void libpg::FactoredApproximator::discountTrace (  )  [virtual]

Just multiply trace by discount factors

The remaining methods just pass onto equiv Approximator functions. We have to do it in this ugly way because more advanced multiple agent approximators will need to override these functions to update all agents in turn.

Implements libpg::Approximator.

Reimplemented in libpg::FactoredApproximatorMinUpdates.

void libpg::FactoredApproximator::computeDirection ( int  steps  )  [virtual]

Update the search direction for the parameters from the current gradient and possible past information. For GPOMDP and most codes this is empty. This could hold conjugation code Or it can extract natural actor critic search direction

Reimplemented from libpg::Approximator.

void libpg::FactoredApproximator::reduce ( Vector &  v,
Approximator::StatsEnum  s 
) [virtual]

Add either the parameters or gradient or traces into a vector

Parameters:
v vector to store stuff into. v must be at least as big as total params/grads/traces. Will not be resized. Will not be cleared.
s whether to collect grads or params or traces

Approximator::StatsEnum  s 
) [virtual]

Disperse either the parameters or gradient or any other type of stat into appropriate data structures for this class. Actually defers to sub approximators.

Parameters:
v Vector to replace current params or grads or traces. Must be correct size
s whether to restore grads or params or traces
s what to set, can't do GRADS here.
